visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a bar chart with the following specifications: Chart type: bar, Chart title: 'Swedish top 10 professions dominated by women (16-64 years) in 2017', Axes and labels styling: X-axis categories should be 'Preschool teacher', 'Home care nurse', 'Nurse', 'Nanny', 'Nurse practitioner', 'Finance Assistant', 'Accountant', 'Nurse assistant', 'Office assistant/secretary', Y-axis labels should be formatted as '{value} %', Data series: Two series named 'Men' and 'Women' with corresponding data, Custom colors: ['#b9d4f8', '#f8b9d4'], Additional configurations: Stacked bar chart with percentage stacking, tooltip with shared format, and accessibility settings for both axes and points.

title.text: Swedish top 10 professions dominated by women (16-64 years) in 2017

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a bar chart that visualizes the gender distribution in the top 10 professions dominated by women in Sweden for individuals aged 16-64 years in 2017. The chart is titled 'Swedish top 10 professions dominated by women (16-64 years) in 2017' and includes a subtitle linking to the source of the data. The X-axis displays the categories of professions, while the Y-axis represents the percentage of gender distribution, formatted to show the percentage symbol. The chart is set to stack the bars by percentage, allowing for a clear comparison of the gender distribution within each profession. The tooltip provides detailed information about the percentage of each gender in a shared format, enhancing accessibility. The series data includes two sets of data, one for 'Men' and one for 'Women', each with specific contrast and border colors to differentiate them visually. The chart also includes accessibility settings for both axes and points, ensuring that the chart is accessible to all users.
